title: 113_s1001
content: The Act titled "Iran Export Embargo Act" imposes sanctions on the government of Iran under the Iran Freedom and Counter-Proliferation Act of 2012. The findings by Congress state that the Government of Iran violates human rights and sponsors terrorism, including recent attacks and defiance of UN resolutions regarding nuclear activities. The Government of Iran violates UN Security Council Resolutions by continuing nuclear activities and supporting terrorist groups in Lebanon and Gaza. They also aid Syria in human rights abuses. The President is required to block all transactions involving Iranian property. The President is mandated to block transactions involving Iranian property and impose sanctions on those facilitating significant transactions with Iran. The President is required to impose sanctions on individuals who import, purchase, or transfer goods or services from Iran, as well as those who provide underwriting services, insurance, or reinsurance to Iranian entities. The President must impose sanctions on individuals who import, purchase, or transfer goods or services from Iran. Sanctions may also be imposed on those providing underwriting services, insurance, or reinsurance to Iranian entities, unless due diligence is exercised to prevent dealings with specified Iranian entities. These entities include the state and Government of Iran, any entities owned or controlled by the Iranian government, and those acting on behalf of the Iranian government. The President must impose sanctions on individuals who import, purchase, or transfer goods or services from Iran, including entities owned or controlled by the Iranian government or acting on its behalf. Sanctions apply regardless of public listing in the Federal Register or OFAC's list. The exportation, importation, sale, or transfer of crude oil from Iran is subject to sanctions 180 days after the enactment of this Act.
